page.title: 15 FARMING YEAR
page.content: Mr. Elliot farms Dene Farm.It is a 96 acre livestock farm.{ { Spring}_ Lambing time and an 18/20 hour working day.In 1985 many sets of triplets have been born,but the weather has been cold and damp for them.Barley is sown to feed livestock during the winter.\ acre of potatoes are planted for domestic use.Grazing fields are spread with fertilizer. {Summer}_ Ewes are clipped and all sheep are dipped.Hay is cut and bailed. {Autumn}_ Stock is bought and sold.New ewes cost Â£85/95.Fat lambs and old ewes are sold off.New ram is introduced every 4/5 years costing between Â£400/500 presently.Calves ae bought at between Â£280 and Â£350. {Winter}_ Quiet time.Care of stock in winter quarters and general farm maintenance.
